title-group.article-title: Rego Concept Proportional Load and Pressure Compensated Cartridge Valve for Mobile Applications

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1985 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: The Rego valve is a load sensing, pressure compensated directional valve of a completely new and unique design. The basic valve element, of which normally four are combined to give a directional valve, is a seat valve which with an internal position feedback is proportionally controlled by activating a small pilot valve. The type of feedback used in this concept gives several unique characteristics which for instance makes it possible to get multiple functions in a simple way. The valve is designed to provide zero-leakage capabilities and great efforts have also been made to get a high degree of flexibility and serviceability. This have been accomplished by using cartridges, designed for easy screw-in installation into form-drilled cavities.

ref.mixed-citation: Backe, W. and Lu, Y. H.: "Proportional -Drosselventilen in 2-Wege- Einbauventil-Bauart". Ölhydraulik und Pneumatik 25 (1981) Nr. 1
Breeden, R.H.: "Development of a High Pressure Load Sensing Mobile Valve". SAE-paper 810697
Scheffel, G.: "Steurungen mit 2-Wege Einbauventilen". Ölhydraulik und Pneumatik Nr. 8 1981

Andersson, Bo R. "On the Val vistor, a Proportionally Control- led Seat Valve". Ph.D. thesis No. 108. Linköping Studies in Science and Technology. Linköping Institute of Technology, Linköping, Sweden. 1984
Bartholomäus, R. and Kreth, N.: "Elektrisch geregelte 2-Wege -Einbauventile". Ölhydraulik und Pneumatik 25 (1981) Nr. 8
Backé, W.: "Neue Konzepte bei der Geräteentwicklung und zur Schaltungstechnik in der Hydraulik". 5. Aachener Kolloquium, 1982
